McDougall","username":"Hunter_McDougall","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/h/8edcca/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-02-21T21:51:50.554Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eRight now, all we are using is the arm motor (named armMotor in IntakeSubsystem). It is supposed to spin when you press LB on the controller (line 80 in RobotContainer.java). When I press LB on the controller, it prints that the command has started, but it never spins the motor. When I put print statements in the execute method, they repeatedly print as they should. The problem is, the arm motor is not turning.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThanks for the help!\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":17,"updated_at":"2023-02-21T21:51:50.554Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":84,"readers_count":83,"score":31.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":427633,"topic_slug":"issues-with-java-command-based-pid-controlled-motor","display_username":"Hunter McDougall","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51438,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/issues-with-java-command-based-pid-controlled-motor/427633/4","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3150138,"name":"Fletch","username":"Fletch1373","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/fletch1373/{size}/220073_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-21T22:00:11.731Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eI dont recommend using magic numbers like \u003ccode\u003e5\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003e3\u003c/code\u003e to refer to buttons.  You can either use enumerated values (like the \u003ccode\u003ekA\u003c/code\u003e a couple lines above), or switch to the \u003ca href=\"https://github.wpilib.org/allwpilib/docs/release/java/edu/wpi/first/wpilibj2/command/button/CommandXboxController.html\"\u003eCommandXboxController class\u003c/a\u003e (new this year) and use href=\"https://docs.wpilib.org/en/stable/docs/software/commandbased/binding-commands-to-triggers.html#hid-factories\"\u003edocs found 50 is what should be doing it.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003ca class=\"mention\" href=\"/u/hunter_mcdougall\"\u003e@Hunter_McDougall\u003c/a\u003e, where did you get your PID constants from? I would leave \u003ccode\u003eI\u003c/code\u003e at 0 and configure feedforward properly (currently itll always be 0 since your ArmFeedForward constants are all 0).  Your P of 0.025 might be too small to actually move the motor (I havent done all the math, but a position error of 10 (setpoint = initialPos+10) looks like it would result in a voltage of 0.25), which would explain why youre not seeing anything.
